content.raw: Your review was still very helpful!

update.description:
This PR build on Pull Request #1 to also enable ignition projects to specify component libraries using `ign_add_component(~)`.

There are a few non-backwards-compatible changes between this and Pull Request #1. You can find explanations of them in the diff of the migration document, but the short list is:

1. `ign_add_library(${PROJECT_LIBRARY_TARGET_NAME} ${sources})` is replaced by `ign_create_main_library(SOURCES ${sources})`

2. `ign_install_all_headers(~)` no longer accepts the argument `ADDITIONAL_DIRS` (all subdirectories will be included by default), and instead you may specify subdirectories to exclude using `EXCLUDE_DIRS`.

3. Remove the `ign_install_library()` function completely, because it is no longer used.

~~For now, I'm targeting the `CMakeRefactor` branch to make this easier to review. I'll change it to target `default` after Pull Request #1 is merged.~~
update.title: [WIP] Creating project components

content.raw: Understood. I'll wait until it's ready to review :)
content.html: Understood. I'll wait until it's ready to review :)

content.raw:
First of all, I apologize for not marking this PR as a `[WIP]`, but I have a few significant changes coming down the line soon for this.

It turns out that `find_dependency(~)` doesn't support cmake components until `cmake-3.9`, so we won't be able to use `find_dependency(~)` at all in our `*-config.cmake` files if we want to be able to specify package components to depend on. In some upcoming changes (which are currently testing well on my machine), we'll be replacing all `find_dependency(~)` calls with `find_package(~)` and dealing with the `REQUIRED` and `QUIET` flags in our own way.
content.html:
First of all, I apologize for not marking this PR as a [WIP], but I have a few significant changes coming down the line soon for this.

It turns out that find_dependency(~) doesn't support cmake components until cmake-3.9, so we won't be able to use find_dependency(~) at all in our *-config.cmake files if we want to be able to specify package components to depend on. In some upcoming changes (which are currently testing well on my machine), we'll be replacing all find_dependency(~) calls with find_package(~) and dealing with the REQUIRED and QUIET flags in our own way.

content.raw: Good catch, this logic is outdated (I wrote it before adding the `PRIVATE` and `INTERFACE` options, when a component had to be either be publicly dependent or not dependent at all). I'll fix this up.
content.html: Good catch, this logic is outdated (I wrote it before adding the PRIVATE and INTERFACE options, when a component had to be either be publicly dependent or not dependent at all). I'll fix this up.

content.raw:
nitpick : find_dependency.

If the component project-component-config.cmake was found, the project-config.cmake will definitely be found so `find_dependency` vs `find_package` makes no difference, but it makes the project-component-config.cmake file consistent.
content.html:
nitpick : find_dependency.

If the component project-component-config.cmake was found, the project-config.cmake will definitely be found so find_dependency vs find_package makes no difference, but it makes the project-component-config.cmake file consistent.

content.raw: Looks like this is a duplicate call `target_link_libraries(... PUBLIC ...)`.
content.html: Looks like this is a duplicate call target_link_libraries(... PUBLIC ...).

content.raw: It looks like this will first publicly link to the main library if the function is given `PRIVATELY_DEPENDS_ON_PROJECT_LIB` but not `INDEPENDENT_FROM_PROJECT_LIB`.
content.html: It looks like this will first publicly link to the main library if the function is given PRIVATELY_DEPENDS_ON_PROJECT_LIB but not INDEPENDENT_FROM_PROJECT_LIB.

content.raw:
~~I doubt we will use this I don't think this needs to be fixed, but I don't see a way to publicly use c++ 11 and privately use c++ 14 with this check.~~

I misunderstood. It looks like this never uses `target_compile_features(... PUBLIC ...)`.
content.html:
I doubt we will use this I don't think this needs to be fixed, but I don't see a way to publicly use c++ 11 and privately use c++ 14 with this check.

I misunderstood. It looks like this never uses target_compile_features(... PUBLIC ...).

content.raw:
Maybe check if the directory starts with something in `EXCLUDE_DIRS` to filter subdirectories of excluded directories?

With EXCLUDE_DIRS `first_level` and a folder structure

```
first_level/
├── private.hh
└── second_level/
    └── private.hh
```

`directories` contains `first_level/second_level` at the end of this loop.
content.html:
Maybe check if the directory starts with something in EXCLUDE_DIRS to filter subdirectories of excluded directories?

With EXCLUDE_DIRS first_level and a folder structure

first_level/
├── private.hh
└── second_level/
    └── private.hh

directories contains first_level/second_level at the end of this loop.

content.raw: Whoops, that was silly of me. We should figure out a meaningful way to unit test the `ign-cmake` utilities XD
content.html: Whoops, that was silly of me. We should figure out a meaningful way to unit test the ign-cmake utilities XD

content.raw:
Passing a bool as a third argument does not set the variable in the parent scope on xenial/3.5.1. Only the text PARENT_SCOPE does it. How about:

```CMake
if(ign_string_append_PARENT_SCOPE)
  set(${output_var} "${${output_var}}${delim}${val}" PARENT_SCOPE)
else()
  set(${output_var} "${${output_var}}${delim}${val}")
endif()
```
content.html:
Passing a bool as a third argument does not set the variable in the parent scope on xenial/3.5.1. Only the text PARENT_SCOPE does it. How about:

if(ign_string_append_PARENT_SCOPE)
  set(${output_var} "${${output_var}}${delim}${val}" PARENT_SCOPE)
else()
  set(${output_var} "${${output_var}}${delim}${val}")
endif()

content.raw: `"PARENT_SCOPE ${options}"` does not create create the option variable for me on xenial/cmake 3.5.1. I have to change this to `"PARENT_SCOPE"`.
content.html: "PARENT_SCOPE ${options}" does not create create the option variable for me on xenial/cmake 3.5.1. I have to change this to "PARENT_SCOPE".
